polished_script:
HOOK: Your MLS is designed to keep you broke. [ON-SCREEN: Your MLS keeps you BROKE]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: There are over 500 MLS systems in America. A buyer calls asking about Austin—you scramble for referrals because you can't pull comps across state lines. You can't analyze trends nationally. You're flying blind on 90% of the country. [ON-SCREEN: 500+ MLS systems] [ON-SCREEN: Can't pull comps across states]
  [15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But Chris Linsell—a real estate tech analyst—just said what NAR won't.

INSIGHT: He rebuilt NAR from scratch and found the one thing that changes everything: a national MLS. [ON-SCREEN: CHRIS LINSELL - Tech Analyst] One unified system, still locally run, but every agent accesses every data point everywhere. Here's what that means tomorrow: buyer calls about Austin, you pull 90 days of closes, filter by price point, text them three neighborhoods with rising inventory—before lunch. [ON-SCREEN: National MLS = Every data point] [ON-SCREEN: 90 days of data in 90 seconds] "Imagine if NAR would say, 'Guys, it's time for a national MLS.'"

REFRAME: Right now you're competing with one hand tied behind your back. A national MLS means you'd know migration patterns before Zillow does, spot buyer trends in real time, and actually be the expert again. [ON-SCREEN: Beat Zillow to the data]

CTA: "Open your last relocation conversation right now—could you serve that client better with national data access?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: Your MLS system is designed to keep you inefficient (and broke). Here's what would change everything...

HASHTAGS: #RealEstate #MLS #RealtorTips #RealEstateData #PropertyExpert

SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "Right now you're competing with one hand tied behind your back."

PERFORMANCE_NOTES: 
1. Punch the word "broke" hard in the hook—make it sting
2. Speed up during the Austin example to show the efficiency contrast  
3. Lean into camera on "actually be the expert again"—emphasize the frustration

_metadata.rewrite_changelog: Condensed insight section by 40% and added concrete example (Austin buyer scenario). Completely rewrote CTA from reflective question to specific 15-minute action with exact steps. Kept strongest line in reframe, eliminated weak rhetorical question.
_metadata.judge_note: The insight section is too long and abstract—cut it in half and add one specific example of what an agent could DO differently with national MLS access tomorrow.
